member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.APSystRow.SaveReceipts
member.summary: Indicates if Receipt transactions are to be used to create invoices. This flag is used by the Receipt entry program to set the value of the RcvHead.SaveForInvoicing. Invoice entry pulls in receipt details Receipt.SaveForInvoicing = Yes and Receipt.Invoiced = No.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.APSystRow.AlwaysDiscount
member.summary: Configures the A/P automatic invoice payment selection process to unconditionally take any available discount amount.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.APSystRow.FmtCode
member.summary: Identifies default aging format, the details of which is stored in the AgingRptFmt table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.APSystRow.DefaultFmtCode
member.summary: Stores the FmtCode of the AgingRptFmt record that is to be considered the A/P default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.APSystRow.CheckPerforationLineNum
member.summary: Used by AP Check printing. It is the line # at which the check perforation is.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.APSystRow.CPayParent
member.summary: For internal use only. Used with CPayCompany to enforce security of the Centralized Payment Parent company.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.APSystRow.CPayCompany
member.summary: Company that is the Parent of Centralized Payment process. More than one company can be attached to a serial number that has the Centralized Payment module entered. This field designates which of those companies is the Central Payment Parent Company and can therefore create invoices flagged for centralized payment.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.APSystRow.AllowReverseCharges
member.summary: Indicates if user is allowed to override the Reverse Charge Method in the AP invoice line.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.APSystRow.RoundTolerance
member.summary: It used to catch rounding differences that might occur when vendor invoices are settled in a currency different from the invoice currency

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.APSystRow.RoundInvoice
member.summary: If the value is true and in case the total balance of an invoice transaction is within the total rounding setup for the currency of the invoice the balance is automatically accepted and booked as a rounding difference. If the value is false the user has to balance the transaction manually.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.APSystRow.LogInvAccting
member.summary: Determines how a logged invoice is processed through the accounting system. TR = Authorization Tracking. Logged invoices are not processed by the Posting Engine. Logging invoices is done for tracking purposes. Full accounting is done when the AP Invoice is created. TA - Account for Taxes. When logged invoices are posted, accounts payable and tax amounts are booked directly to the respective accounts, the invoice net amount is posted to a Logged Invoice Suspense Account. The entry is removed from the suspense account when the logged invoice is converted to an AP Invoice. S - Book All to a Suspense Account. When the logged invoice is posted the tax invoice and net amount are posted to a Logged Invoice Suspense Account. The entry is removed from the suspense account when the logged invoice is voided or converted to a regular AP Invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.APSystRow.AuthAdmins
member.summary: List of authorized administrators who are able to mark a logged action as complete.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.APSystRow.LogInvAutoAprv
member.summary: Indicates if Logged Invoices are created in an Aprpoved state or if they must be manually approved. If the Accounting Option is 'Authorization Tracking' logged invoices can not be auto approved.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARSystRow.StartInvoiceNum
member.summary: Used to establish the beginning Invoice #. When the system generates a new InvcHead it will assign the greater of (StartInvoiceNum) or (the last Invoice # on file + 1) as the invoice number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARSystRow.SaveShipments
member.summary: Indicates if Shipment transactions are to be used to create invoices. This flag is used by the Shipping entry program to set the value of the "Invoiced" flag field. (see ShipHead.Invoiced). Invoice entry generates invoices for Shipments which contain "Invoiced" flag = No.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARSystRow.CreditOrderAction
member.summary: Order Entry action to a Credit Held customer. Valid values are "WARN" or "STOP". WARN means that the user is given a warning, but allowed to proceed (or cancel) with the order and customer placed on credit hold. STOP means that the order line addition/change to the order is not accepted and the order and customer are not placed on credit hold.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARSystRow.CreditShipAction
member.summary: Shipping Entry action to a Credit Held order. Valid values are "WARN" or "STOP". WARN means that the user is warned that the order is on credit hold, but allowed to proceed (or cancel) with the shipment. STOP means that the shipment for that order is not accepted.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARSystRow.SJJournalCode

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARSystRow.AJJournalCode
member.summary: The Journal Code of the Journal that will be used for A/R adjustments and application of credit memos. Normally this would be called the Adjustments Journal.

member.summary: A integer that express the # of days from the date quoted that someone should follow up with the customer concerning the quote. This is used by quote entry to calculate a default follow up date (QuoteHed.FollowUpDate). Default follow up date is QuoteHed.DateQuoted + EQSyst.FollowUpDays

member.summary: Used to establish the beginning Service Call Number. When the system generates a new Service Call it will assign the greater of (StartServiceCallNum) or (the last Service Call Number on file + 1) as the Service Call number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.FsSystRow.ExpireHorizon
member.summary: This is the window of days that is used to determine if a service contract is going to expire soon. If the current date plus the expire horizon is greater than or equal to the entered expire date on a contract, the contract is considered to be expiring soon.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.FsSystRow.PrintPrice
member.summary: This flag is used when printing service call tickets. If "YES" then labor and material pricing will print on the ticket.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.FsSystRow.CallProdCode
member.summary: Product Group Code. This will be used as a default for service calls. This can be blank or must be valid in the ProdGrup table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.FsSystRow.CallJobPrefix
member.summary: This prefix will be used for service call job. The service call job will be the prefix + service call number + service call Line number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.FsSystRow.ContractStartup
member.summary: This flag is to be set to 'YES' during intial startup. When this flag is set to 'YES' all Service Contracts will be created as active invoiced and shipped. The idea is that a cusomter that purchases FS may already have active service contracts that have been invoiced.

member.summary: This field stores the allowed Contract Renewal Period which is used to determine how long a contract/renewal can be renewed past its expiration date. If the RenewalPeriod = 0 then it means that ALL expired contracts can still be renewed anytime.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GLSystRow.ARInterfaced
member.summary: Indicates if the A/R module is interfaced with General Ledger. When interfaced A/R posting routines will automatically create "posted" journal entries in G/L.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GLSystRow.APInterfaced
member.summary: Indicates if the Accounts Payable module is interfaced with General Ledger. When interfaced A/P posting routines will automatically create "posted" journal entries in G/L.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GLSystRow.PRInterfaced
member.summary: Indicates if the Payroll module is interfaced with General Ledger. When interfaced, P/R posting routines will automatically create "posted" journal entries in G/L.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GLSystRow.PostInvtyWipCos
member.summary: Configuration option which controls if the user has the option in the periodic Inventory/Wip/Cost of sales calculation process to post the results to general ledger. If this is set to No then the user will not have the option to post to G/L.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GLSystRow.GJJournalCode
member.summary: The Journal Code of the Journal that will be used for Journal entry transactions. Manual Journal entries.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GLSystRow.ARVoucherInvoices
member.summary: Indicates if the user wants to use Vouchering for A/R Invoices. Only available if the G/L module is installed. If yes then the system will do the following - Print a Voucher # on the invoice. - When invoices are printed they will be automatically posted. . The "Voucher number" is actually the Journal Number to which the invoice posted.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GLSystRow.APVoucherInvoices
member.summary: Indicates if the user wants to use Vouchering for A/P Invoices. Only available if the G/L module is installed. If yes then the system will print a Voucher assignment log when A/P invoices are posted. The "Voucher number" is actually the Journal Number to which the invoice posted.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GLSystRow.AllowUnBalancedEntries
member.summary: Allow unbalanced entries to be entered in General Journal Entry with a warning.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GLSystRow.AllowManualGJEntries
member.summary: Allow manual General Journal entries to be made for System Accounts.

member.summary: Flag to indicate that an External GL interface is being used

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GLSystRow.MasterCOA
member.summary: Identifies the Master COA for the company

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GLSystRow.BatchGLBalances
member.summary: Indicates if GL balances are maintained real time or in batch. If Yes, the GLJrnDtl write trigger does NOT update the GLPeriodBal table. If No, the GLJrnDtl write trigger updates the GLPeriod table. The default value is no.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GLSystRow.BatchGLDailyBal
member.summary: If BatchGLBalances = yes the users have the ability to have the daily balances updated in batch mode. This option is only available if BatchGLBalances equals Yes. A Yes in this field indicates the GLJrnDtl write trigger does not update the GLDailyBal table. If No, the GLJrnDtl write trigger updates the GLDailyBalTable. The default value is No.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.GLSystRow.MatchUsingCurrentDate
member.summary:
This option determines which date gets stored in the GLJrnDtl.MatchDate field when GL transactions are matched.
If true, then the date that the transactions are matched is used. If false, then the latest apply date of the matched transactions is used.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.ClockFormat
member.summary: Indicates the format of how labor time is entered. It can be entered as (M) - hours/minutes or (H) - Hours/Hundredths.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.FeedPayroll
member.summary: Indicates if the labor entry details will be transferred to the Payroll system. This is used to set the value of LaborDtl.Payroll flag.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.RemoveLoad
member.summary: Controls how shop load is removed. It can either be by Actual Hours "H" or based on quantity completed "Q".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.MachinePrompt
member.summary: Controls whether or not entry of a Machine ID will be prompted for in Labor Entry and Labor Collection.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.ReworkReasons
member.summary: Indicates if system should prompt for entry of a Rework Reason code for rework transactions during Labor Collection or Labor Entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.ScrapReasons
member.summary: Indicates if system should prompt user to enter a Scrap Reason code for labor transactions where the scrap quantity is not zero during Labor Entry or Labor Collection.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.JobSeqLength
member.summary: Indicates the maximum number of digits to be entered into the JCSyst.NextJobNum field. This also controls the number of digits that the system will generate when the user requests a "Next Job Number" while creating a new job number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.NextJobNumber
member.summary: The value in this field represents the next default job sequence number. The number of digits that can be entered is controlled by JCSyst.JobSeqLength. Example of how the system uses these fields to generate a number that is inserted as part of the Job number when the user requests "Next Job Number" while creating a new job number would be: JobSeqLength = 6 and NextJobNumber = 100. Then the system would try to insert "000100" into the job number at the current insertion point.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.Grace
member.summary: Grace Period, stored as Hours/Hundredths

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.StdFormat
member.summary: Default qualifier for the Production Standard field. This is used as a default to the qualifier field in operation details when there is no related OpStd record. The valid qualifiers are: "HP" - Hours/Piece, "MP" - minutes/piece, "PH" - pieces/hour, "PM" - Pieces/Minute, "OH" - Operations/Hour, "OM" - Operations/minute, HR - Fixed Hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.StdBasis
member.summary: Default standard basis is to be used to with standards that are time per piece (HP & MP). The basis is a Divisor. Valid codes are E-Eaches, C=100's, M=1000's, T=10,000. This field is used in the formula for calculating the estimated production hours. The operation quantity is divided by the basis value and then multiplied by the standard to result in hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.EstScrapType
member.summary: Default for the JobOper and QuoteOpr.EstScrapType fields

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.InvAdjReasons
member.summary: Indicates if system should prompt user to enter an Inventory Adjustment Reason code for quantity and cost adjustments.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.SchedCode
member.summary: SchedPri.SchedCode value that is marked as the default scheduling code in the Scheduling Priority Code master file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.SchedStartedOps
member.summary: Default for scheduling operations that have been started. A started operation is one with labor reported to it. Global Scheduling uses this value.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.WksLaborHistWarn
member.summary: The number of weeks labor warning detail is stored until they are purged.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.GenLaborWarnMsg
member.summary: This option controls whether or not the labor warnings messages are generated/reported. When this option is turned on labor warning records are created and the labor edit list and/or entry/tracker programs report these warnings. When it is turned off the labor edit list performs its own warning checking and no warnings are reported in the entry/tracker programs. This option should only be turned on between labor periods (i.e. after all of the labor has been reported, but before the next periods information has been entered). Only maintainable if the Data Collection module has been installed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.PreventPJChange
member.summary: If set to Yes, the user must change the Job Engineered flag to No before they are allowed to make any changes to a Job.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.LogChanges
member.summary: If this is Yes, then when Jobs are set to "Planned" or any header flag is changed on a "Planned" job the user will be prompted to enter a description of the changes. This option is only available when "PreventPJChange" = Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.EarlyClockInAllowance
member.summary: Number of minutes used by data collection to determine the time frame in which early clock in times are to be adjusted forward to the shift start time. If clock in time falls within the time range of (Shift Start - Allowance) to Shift Start then the clock in time will set to Shift Start time.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.LateClockInAllowance
member.summary: Number of minutes used by data collection to determine the time frame in which late clock in times are to be adjusted backwards to the shift start time. If clock in time falls within the time range of Shift Start to (Shift Start + Allowance) then the clock in time will set to Shift Start time.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.EarlyClockOutAllowance
member.summary: Number of minutes used by data collection to determine the time frame in which early clock out times are to be adjusted forward to the shift end time. If clock out time falls within the time range of (Shift End - Allowance) to Shift End then the clock out time will set to Shift end.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.LateClockOutAllowance
member.summary: Minutes used to determine the time frame in which late clock out times are to be adjusted backwards to the shift end time. If clock out time falls within the time range of Shift end to (Shift Start + Allowance) then the clock out time will set to Shift End time.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.FloatPartRev
member.summary: Default for "Floating " the part revision. To "Float" the revision of unfirm jobs to the revision in effect at the time of the requirement.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.ForecastDaysBefore
member.summary: Number of days before the forecast date in which any sales orders that exist should reduce the forecast quantity. Ex: Forecast date of 3/31/98, Days before of 10, then any orders that have a date of 3/21/98 to 3/31/98 would reduce the forecast.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.ForecastDaysAfter
member.summary: Number of days after the forecast date in which any sales orders that exist should reduce the forecast quantity. Ex: Forecast date of 3/31/98, Days after of 10, then any orders that have a date of 4/01/98 to 4/10/98 would reduce the forecast.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.DetailGrace
member.summary: Indicates if the LateClockIn or EarlyClockOut grace period should be applied to the labor detail transactions. Ex: 10 minute LateClockIn, Shift Start = 8:00am, Employee clocks in and starts an activity at 8:05. If DetailGrace = Yes then StartTime on the detail will be adjusted to 8:00. If DetailGrace = No then StartTime remains as 8:05 and an the 5 minutes will be included in the idle time. This setting does NOT affect how Start/End times are adjusted for the timecard record. In both cases for this example the start time for the timecard will be 8:00.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.PreventFABypass
member.summary: If set to Yes, the user is unable to start production work for an operation which is waiting for First Article approval.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.ChgImpactPriceListCode
member.summary: Used to get a value for jobs not referencing a sales order. If a part in not in the price list then use Part.UnitPrice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.EarlyGracePeriod
member.summary: Used in conjunction with the Late Grace Period to determine if a job is early, on-time or late. Example: Early Grace Period is 4, Late Grace Period is 1, Job Required Date is 05/20/02: If the job is scheduled to be completed before 05/16/02 it is Early. If the job is scheduled to be completed anywhere from 05/16/02 through 05/21/02 it is on-time. If the job is scheduled to be completed after 05/21/02 it is late.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.LateGracePeriod
member.summary: Used in conjunction with the Early Grace Period to determine if a job is early, on-time or late. Example: Early Grace Period is 4, Late Grace Period is 1, Job Required Date is 05/20/02: If the job is scheduled to be completed before 05/16/02 it is Early. If the job is scheduled to be completed anywhere from 05/16/02 through 05/21/02 it is on-time. If the job is scheduled to be completed after 05/21/02 it is late.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.QuickJobID
member.summary: NJ - Next Job OR - Order Release

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.KanBanPrefix
member.summary: KanBanPrefix

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.NextOrderNumber
member.summary: The value in this field represents the next default transfer Order sequence number. The number of digits that can be entered is controlled by JCSyst.OrderSeqLength. Example of how the system uses these fields to generate a number that is inserted as part of the Transfer Order number when the user requests "Next Order Number" while creating a new Transfer Order number would be: OrderSeqLength = 6 and NextOrderNumber = 100. Then the system would try to insert "000100" into the Order number at the current insertion point.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.OrderSeqLength
member.summary: Indicates the maximum number of digits to be entered into the JCSyst.NextOrderNum field. This also controls the number of digits that the system will generate when the user requests a "Next Order Number" while creating a new order number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.NextTranLineNumber
member.summary: The value in this field represents the next default transfer Order Line sequence number. The number of digits that can be entered is controlled by JCSyst.OrderSeqLength. Example of how the system uses these fields to generate a number that is inserted as part of the Transfer Detail Line number when the user requests "Next Line Number" when converting an MRP Transfer Line number would be: OrderSeqLength = 6 and NextTranLineNumber = 100. Then the system would try to insert "000100" into the Line Number at the current insertion point.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.AllowSchedulingBeforeToday
member.summary: Determines if a scheduler is allowed to schedule/reschedule jobs/operations (from the Scheduling Boards) to do work before today.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.DirectShipVar
member.summary: Indicates where to post all variances on a job that shipped direct for a standard cost part. M = to the Product Group, C = to the Cost of Sales.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.SplitMfgCostElements
member.summary: Flag to indicate how to split the manufacturing cost elements when a manufactured material is issued to the job. If flag is set to true, the cost of the issued material will be split into individual manufacturing cost elements. If set to false, the cost of the issued material is added to the manufacturing material cost element only.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.UnfirmATP
member.summary: This flag is used by ATP to determine if Unfirm Jobs should be considered in ATP calculations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.ForecastPeriods
member.summary:
The ForecastPeriods field defines the forecast periods that are used with the import and export process.
Examples: Year, Semester, Quarter, Month, Week, Day
This field is used with the ForecastPeriodsPerYear field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.ForecastPeriodsPerYear
member.summary:
The ForecastPeriodsPerYear field defines the number of forecast periods per year.
This field is used with the ForecastPeriods field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.ReplaceMissingValues
member.summary:
The ReplaceMissingValues field is used to determine how periods with zero demand should be exported when exporting forecast data.
If yes, then zero demand will be replaced with the string "MISSING" as long as there is no demand in previous periods. If previous periods have some demand, then zero demand will be left as zero.
If the value of this field is no, then zero demand will be left as zero when exporting demand.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.ForecastImportDay
member.summary:
The ForecastImportDay field is used by the forecast import process to determine the forecast date for each forecast period.
The valid values for this field are dependent on the value in the ForecastPeriods field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.ChkEmpPrjRole
member.summary: If false then when an employee is booking hours to a job they can enter any Project Role code that has been set up on the employee. When the field is set to true then the Project Role entered MUST be one of the Project Role codes that have been assigned to the operation.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.JCSystRow.DfltPrjRoleLoc

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.TaxSvcConfigRow.TaxConnectEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether the Epicor Tax Connect interface is active for this company. If false, no Tax Connect address validation or tax calculations will take place regardless of how the company flags are set for those functions.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.TaxSvcConfigRow.AddrValEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether the system can perform address validation via Epicor Tax Connect. If TaxConnectEnabled flag = true this flag will be checked to see if address validations are authorized/available via the Epicor Tax Connect. If false no address validation logic will be executed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.TaxSvcConfigRow.TaxCalcEnabled

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.TaxSvcConfigRow.ETCOffline
member.summary: External field to be used to indicate that the Tax Connect service is off line. This filed can be set by the BL when a communication failure with tax connect occurs, or can be set manually in the UI when the user indicates that tax connect is offline. If set to true then the BL will not attempt any communication with the tax service. This is used to save unnecessary processing delays trying to communicate with the tax service when it is known that the service is unavailable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.ShipNoJob
member.summary: Controls the entry of ship from job quantity in shipping entry program. If set to "yes" then job quantity field is enabled regardless of the order being linked to a job. This is intended only to be set to "yes" during the initial system implementation period. So that users can create and ship orders for manufactured items without forcing them to have established jobs

member.summary: Default Miscellaneous Freight Charge Customer Connect

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.SODiscountUnitPrice
member.summary: Specifies if line discounts shall be applied to the unit price or the line value.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.DefUOMClassID
member.summary: Default Unit of Measure Class. Used as the default value when creating new Part masters. Must be valid in the UOMClass table. The UOMClass has a default UOMCode which replaces the 8.3 XASyst.DefaultUM.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.AlphaNumeric
member.summary: The character that will represent the place holder for any alphanumeric character ((e.g. 5 / A / a). Default is "&"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.AlphaNumExample
member.summary: Indicates the string to use when constructing an Example for a serial mask in Serial Mask Maintenance and the AlphaNumeric character is part of the mask. The default is "A".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.AlphaOnly
member.summary: This is the character used to represent alpha characters (e.g. [a to z] or [A to Z]). Default is "@"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.AlphaOnlyExample
member.summary: Indicates the string to use when constructing an Example for a serial mask in Serial Mask Maintenance and the AlphaOnly character is part of the mask. The default will be "B".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.NumericOnly
member.summary: This is the character used to represent a numeric character (e.g. [0 to 9]). Default is "#".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.AnyMandatory
member.summary: This is the character used to represent a mandatory variable that can be any alphanumeric character. Therefore if the user enters 2 followed by this character in the mask then when a serial number is created these charaters must be replaced with any single character. Default is "?"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.OptionalAlphaNumeric
member.summary: This character is used to represent an optional variable that can be any alphanumeric character. NOTE this character can ONLY be added as the last characters in the mask. Default is "!"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.StripChar
member.summary: This character is used to represent the characters that are to be stripped off when the internal serial number is created. This character can ONLY be at the front or back of the mask. The default is "~"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.DayChar
member.summary: When this character is entered in the mask surrounded by <> characters then a day number as a 2 numeric value will be automatically inserted into the serial number at that position. This will consume 2 characters of the serial number string. (Only allowed for auto generation masks). The default is "D"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.MonthChar
member.summary: When this character is entered in the mask surrounded by <> characters this will then automatically enter into the serial number the month number as a 2 numeric value. This will consume 2 characters of the serial number string. (Only allowed for auto generation masks). The default is "M"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.Year2Char
member.summary: When this is 2 character string is entered in the mask surrounded by <> characters this will then automatically enter into the serial number the last 2 numeric values of the current calendar year. This must be entered as 2 identical characters and will consume 2 characters of the serial number string. (Only allowed for auto generation masks). The default is "YY"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.Year4Char
member.summary: When this 4 character string is entered in the mask surrounded by < > characters this will then automatically enter into the serial number the full value of the year. This must be entered as 4 identical characters and will consume 4 characters of the serial number string. (Only allowed for auto generation masks) The default is "YYYY"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.PartChar
member.summary: If this is entered in the mask it must be followed by a hard coded numeric value indicating the number of characters of the part number that will be included in the serial number. The PartChar and the hard coded number should be encased in <> characters when building the mask. E.g. if the part representation character is entered as "P" and the part number is DS4000-1 and <P6> is entered in the mask then DS4000 will be included in the serial number. The default is "P". (Only allowed for auto generation masks)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.PartCharExample
member.summary: Indicates the string to use when constructing an Example for a serial mask in Serial Mask Maintenance and the PartChar character is part of the mask. The default will be ?EPICORSERIALNUMBERMASKFORMATEXAMPLE?.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XaSystRow.SODiscountRound
member.summary: Discount rounding option: NE - Round net price by extended amount, NP - Round net price by unit price, EP - Round discount by extended amount; UP - Round discount by unit price.

This file contains new page controls characters. The Page size needs to be configurable to handle other paper sizes (ex: A4). At this time we will allow for a page size setting to be established at the company level.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.PORelShipOption
member.summary: Valid values = "None", "Short" and "Create". At the time a container is shipped, if this option is set to "Short", the PO release quantity is reduced. If this option is set to "Create" the PO release quantity is reduced to the shipping quantity and a new PO release is created for the difference between the original po release quantity and the ship quantity. If this field is not set or None is selected than PO releases are not created nor are they shipped short. This is an optional field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.QtyDsplyDec
member.summary: Controls the number of decimal places that the UI uses to display a "quantiity" field. This only controls the display, the actual number of decimals that can be entered is based on the Unit of Measure. (UomConv.NumOfDec)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.PORelRcptOption
member.summary: Valid values = "Short" and "Create". When the container arrives, if this option is set to "Short", the PO release quantity is reduced. If this option is set to "Create" the PO release quantity is reduced to the arrived quantity and a new PO release is created for the difference between the original po release quantity and the arrived quantity. This is an optional field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.AllowShipToChange
member.summary: If true, then the shipto can be changed on the packing slip to a different shipto than on the Order Release. However, it can only be changed to one of the shipto's that are referenced on the order.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.DefDisburseMethod
member.summary: Identifies how the landed cost will be disbursed among the receipt details. Valid options are Volume , Weight, Value, Quantity and Manual.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.AllowSplitContainer
member.summary: Flag to indicate if container shipment lines can be split into another container shipment.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.AllowTransferIndCost
member.summary: Flag to indicate if Indirect Costs from one container shipment can be transferred to another.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.AllowReceiptLC
member.summary: Flag to indicate if Landed Cost maintenance is allowed in Receipt Entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.AllowLCAfterReceipt
member.summary: Allow maintenance of Landed Cost after the part is received.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.AllowUpdTransValue
member.summary: Allow update of PO Transaction Value during Container Landed Cost Entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.DisableLCUplift
member.summary: Do not allow use of Uplift Percent during Landed Cost calculation.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.AllowDirectRollUp
member.summary: Default value is false. When set to true then all indirect/direct roll-up radio buttons in Part Master and Job Entry should be enabled.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.SyncSubstWeight
member.summary: Synchronize substance weight

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.StopAtFirstFailure
member.summary: Indicates if the RoHS Compliance Process will stop at the first failure it founds.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.OrderHistDays
member.summary: Number of days to look back when processing Orders for the Build From Order History

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.AllowUpdSuppPrice
member.summary: Indicates if user is allowed to update the Supplier Price for Receipt created by Purchase Order.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.SuppPerctTolerance
member.summary: It is used to catch differences between updated Supplier Price for Receipt and PO Unit Price. If no value entered then do not perform percentage check.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.SuppMonetaryTolerance
member.summary: It is used to catch differences between extended values of updated Supplier Price for Receipt and PO Unit Price. If no value entered then do not perform monetary check.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.XbSystRow.SuppPriceLimitAction
member.summary: Receipt action to value of Supplier Price. Valid values are "WARN" or "STOP". WARN means that the user is given a warning, but allowed to proceed (or cancel) the Receipt with that Supplier Price. STOP means that the Receipt line is not correct and the user should go to PO and update PO Unit Price to make receipt with mentioned price.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.AddrSource
member.summary: This is an additional field that will be required to designate the type of address that is being validated (customer, plant, etc)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.AddrSourceID
member.summary: This is an additional field to contain an appropriate piece of data to be used with the AddrSource for display in the UI to clarify for the user what data the validated address relates to. Such as AddrSource = Customer and AddrSourceID = ?Addison?

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.UpdateAddr
member.summary: This is an additional field that will be set if the user has indicated that the Vantage address should be updated from the address validation results.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.TransactionID
member.summary: This value will come from Avalara ValidateResult TransactionID and identifies a unique specific request/response set. It will be used to tie the ETCValidAddress and ETCMessage rows to ETCAddress.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.UpdateAllowed
member.summary: This field will be set if by the process calling address validation to indicate whether the user should have the option to update the original address within the address validation UI.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.RequestID
member.summary: Programmatically assign unique key to tie the ETCAddress table, the ETCValidAddress table and the ETCMessages table together.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.AddressCode
member.summary: Programmatically determined value used internally by the adapter. Defaults to the hash code of the Address object.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.AddressType
member.summary: The type of address that was coded (PO Box, Rural Route, and so on), using the input address. This probably needs Code/desc data Avalara will return F = Firm or company address; G = General Delivery address; H= High-rise or business complex; P = PO Box address; R = Rural route address; S = Street or residential address

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.CarrierRoute
member.summary: The carrier route associated with the input address (USA). This probably needs Code/desc data Avalara will return B = PO Box; C = City Delivery; G= General Delivery; H = Highway Contract; R = Rural route.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidCity
member.summary: City name

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidCountry
member.summary: Country name

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.County
member.summary: County name

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.FipsCode
member.summary: Federal Information Processing Standards Code (USA). This is a unique code representing each geographic combination of state, county, and city. The code is made up of the Federal Information Processing Code (FIPS) that uniquely identifies each state, county, and city in the U.S. See Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) Codes for more details. Digits 1-2 are the state code, digits 3-5 are the county code and digits 6-10 are the city code.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidLine1
member.summary: Line one of the valid address returned by the tax integration.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidLine2
member.summary: Line two of the valid address returned by the tax integration.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidLine3
member.summary: Line three of the valid address returned by the tax integration.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidLine4
member.summary: Line four of the valid address returned by the tax integration.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidPostalCode
member.summary: Postal code returned by the tax integration.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.PostNet
member.summary: A 12-digit POSTNet barcode (USA). Digits 1-5 = ZIP code, digits 6-9 = Plus4 Code, digits 10-11 = delivery point, digit 12 = check digit

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidRegion
member.summary: State or province name or abbreviation returned by the tax integration.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ResultCode
member.summary: This needs Code/desc data. Avalara will return a single code for each address validation request. We will include the result code in each ETCValidAddress row. Success = Operation Succeeded; Warning = Warnings occured, operation succeeded, Error = Errors occured, operation failed; Exception = Unexpected exceptions occurred, operation failed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ResultSeq
member.summary: This is an additional field to set a unique sequence for each ValidMessage returned for a specific TransactionId.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.CarrierRouteDesc
member.summary: Carrier Route description

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.AddressTypeDesc
member.summary: Address type description

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.CountryNum
member.summary: A unique integer assigned by the system to new countries by the maintenance program. This field is used as the foreign key to identify the country in other files such as Customer, or vendor. The end user should never need to know about the value of this field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.InvoiceNum
member.summary: Foreign key to the InvcHead.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.InvoiceLine
member.summary: This field along with Company and InvoiceNum make up the unique key to the table. The system generates this number during entry of new detail records. The system determines next available number by finding the last InvcDtl record for the Invoice and adding 1 to it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ACWPercentage
member.summary: Auto consume window percentage: this is a percentage to calculate the auto consume window days that scheduling engine will take in consideration to look for available quantity to consume. The purpose of this is to look ahead for a few days that will save more time than building the goods, so unless we get the full qty “current date” we need to use the window to look for the remaining.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCMessageRow.TransactionID
member.summary: This value will come from Avalara ValidateResult TransactionID and identifies a unique specific request/response set. It will be used to tie the ETCMessage row to ETCAddress.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCMessageRow.AddrSource
member.summary: This is an additional field that will be required to designate the type of address that is being validated (customer, plant, etc)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCMessageRow.AddrSourceID
member.summary: This is an additional field to contain an appropriate piece of data to be used with the AddrSource for display in the UI to clarify for the user what data the validated address relates to. Such as AddrSource = Customer and AddrSourceID = ?Addison?

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCMessageRow.RequestID
